qas.question: Which wound allowed Kerry to leave combat duty?
Where was Kerry reassigned in April 1969?

answers.text: the Brooklyn-based Atlantic Military Sea Transportation Service

qas.question: When did Kerry become a lieutenant?
Who was Kerry a personal aide for?
When did Kerry leave the Naval Reserve?

context: After Kerry's <a0_0>third<a0_0/> qualifying wound, he was entitled per Navy regulations to reassignment away from combat duties. Kerry's preferred choice for reassignment was as a military aide in Boston, New York or Washington, D.C. On April 11, 1969, he reported to <a1_0>the Brooklyn-based Atlantic Military Sea Transportation Service<a1_0/>, where he would remain on active duty for the following year as a personal aide to an officer, <a3_0>Rear Admiral Walter Schlech<a3_0/>. On <a2_0>January 1, 1970<a2_0/> Kerry was temporarily promoted to full Lieutenant. Kerry had agreed to an extension of his active duty obligation from December 1969 to August 1970 in order to perform Swift Boat duty. John Kerry was on active duty in the United States Navy from August 1966 until January 1970. He continued to serve in the Naval Reserve until <a4_0>February 1978<a4_0/>.
